definition: to select/to choose/to pick over/to pick out/to differentiate/to eliminate/also pr. [zhai2]
"hand" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 64), occurring in 提, 把, 打 etc
by fair means or foul/by hook or by crook/unscrupulously
when hungry, you can't pick what you eat (idiom); beggars can't be choosers/When matters are urgent, don't spend time choosing alternatives.
to speak incoherently/to ramble/to talk irresponsibly
to pick the edible part of vegetables
to choose the right course and follow it (idiom)

sentences.english: With core shaft clamping, control the clamping force at the same time, choose the appropriate points.
sentences.chinese: 采用芯轴装夹，同时控制装夹力，择合适的受力点。

sentences.english: The main road was flooded so we had to go round by narrow country lanes .
sentences.chinese: 公路干线遭水淹没，我们只得择乡间小径绕行。

sentences.english: That is, one feels that everything that happens is destiny's way of reaching its ultimate purpose, and so should be considered good.
sentences.chinese: 也即，他觉得万事皆择其命理之道而行之，故而为善。

sentences.english: Optional handling leaves the ladybug sealed inside a clear plastic bag.
sentences.chinese: 择处理叶片瓢虫密封车厢明确胶袋。

definition: by fair means or foul/by hook or by crook/unscrupulously
to rack one's brains for schemes (idiom)/to beat one's brains out
to do the very opposite/to act in a diametrically opposite way
pinyin: fan3 qi2 dao4 er2 xing2 zhi1

definition: committing all manner of crimes/completely unscrupulous
pinyin: wu2 suo3 bu4 yong4 qi2 ji2

definition: to abandon/to relinquish/to discard/to throw away
